intro: Symphyostemon flexuosus, commonly known as the flexible symphyostemon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, often twisting stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in umbels, and bloom during the wet season. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
